item.title: Day 97: Hugo
item.description: This article is part of The 100 Days Offensive. Go to Day 96. It is decided: I will use Hugo as content management system and deploy my blog as static web site. I really like the simplicity of the concept and the speed as a result. Furthermore I can use my favorite editor. I installed Hugo using WSL2 under Windows 10. I can prevent any broken URL through aliases within the CMS.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: Spezifikation Fahrrad Hintergrund Ich fahre nicht viel, eine Tagesfahrleistung von 20km wird nur selten überschritten. Nach einiger Überlegung soll es KEIN Pedelec sondern ein normales Rad werden. Komfort vor Geschwindigkeit: Ich möchte gerne Radfahren, nicht besonders schnell ankommen Wartungsarm ist ein absolutes Muss: Ich bin handwerklich eine komplette Niete und hasse es, Dinge selber machen zu müssen. Das Rad gebe ich gerne einmal in die Wartung und die darf was kosten, den Rest des Jahres soll es ohne jeden Eingriff einfach tun.

item.title: Day 96: The New Blogger (Migrating Away)
item.description:
This article is part of The 100 Days Offensive. Go to Day 95. Google does it again: They are slowly strangling a working system. You may have noticed that my blog had problems with images lately. The reason for those problems is this:
Google once again starts to pointing a gun at a service I’m using. The “new Blogger” has critical issues, but offers no UI to file those critical issues.

item.title: About this blog
item.description: A few weeks back, I decided that I will write up some pieces about the books I read lately. At first I planned to put them on Google+. But I was not very happy about what could be done there in terms of formatting, overview or references to other reviews. So the decision came to start this blog, but I am not sure if the setup is correct yet. Do comments work?
